intro: Anthospermum pachyrrhizum, commonly known as the thick-rooted starflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, fibrous root system and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. The plant is adapted to grow in nutrient-poor soils and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade.
